Chapter on Contemplating the Heavens, Part 18, Heaven of YÄma, Part 4
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate the places in the Heaven of YÄma.
They see, hear, and know:
In the Heaven of YÄma there is another place called Accumulated Burdens.
What karma do sentient beings have that causes them to be born in that place?
They see, hear, and know:

If one practices good karma, diligently upholds precepts, never harms others, upholds precepts in harmony, accomplishes them without deficiency, without holes, without gaps, firmly, without destruction, is able to close the gates to all evil paths, cools all the torments of evil paths, and is able to provide refuge like parents in the future,
and practices in accordance with the three kinds of merits and virtues, then one will be born there.
What are the three kinds?
Namely, not killing, not stealing, and not engaging in sexual misconduct.
Not killing and not stealing are as explained above.
As for not engaging in sexual misconduct:

Whether walking along the road or in the four directions, going from street to street, either begging for food or sometimes walking for other reasons, if they see women of various singing and dancing, adorned with sounds, they do not give rise to affection or wish for it, do not rejoice in the heart when seeing others do it, celebrate others' good deeds, teach others to repent, speak of their faults, saying that this is the foremost cause of women's faults, namely, wrong conduct, and by this cause and condition, it can cause sentient beings to fall into hell.
Thus, upholding the precepts, pure in conduct, at the end of life and body, they are reborn in the Heaven of YÄma in the place of Mount Sumbha.
Having been born there, by the power of good karma, they experience pleasure there.
Namely, Mount Sumbha is five hundred yojanas high, filled with birds with lovely sounds. The sound of peacocks is very abundant in the mountains, and the sounds in the entire mountain are lovely.

However, when those gods are first born, they are born like this under a tree of the seven treasures, just as a person sleeping in JambudvÄ«pa is awakened by others clapping their hands and hearing the sound, so are those gods awakened by the lovely sound of the birds.
The light of the body of those gods surpasses the light of the sun emerging from the mountain peak in autumn.
That sunlight is not even a little bit similar, the light of the gods is superior.
When those gods suddenly awaken, by the power of their good karma, they cause those birds to sing verses corresponding to good karma, saying:
Free from the bonds of sinew snares, in places of feces, urine, and spittle,
In such a woman's body, therefore come to be born here.
Deceiving, crooked, and not upright, seeing a man, the mind is delighted,
The mind is confused and does not abide steadily, you come because you do not recognize.
False words deceive others, adorning to make people happy,
Those skillful and deceptive women are good at deceiving men.
Women are like bees, enjoying various flowers,
In various men's places, they give rise to such fondness.
Just as a bee sucks on a flower and then leaves for another place,
Women are also like this, sucking on a man and going to another place.
Obtaining things like a virtuous person, always angry and difficult to tame,
Having deceived a man, they go to another place.
Using deception, illusion, and weapons, like bad poison,
These women kill men and can do harm.
Just like wind, space, and fire, they cannot be grasped or held,
With various many skillful means, women cannot be protected.
Harm, illness, death, and doing unwholesome actions,
Women are the primary cause that can destroy the practice of nirvana.
If one is in various places, in narrow and fearful places,
The suffering that men in the world obtain, all due to women.
Not young, not middle-aged, not old, not tranquil,
Women's nature is fickle, like the light of the sun.
Women are not constant friends, like the flickering of a lamp,
They are always enemies, like writing on a stone.
Only those who are close to the wealthy, those without wealth are despised,
Those with wealth are approached by women, those without wealth are abandoned by women.
Giving wealth, giving offerings, making various merits,
Their minds are like flames, and cannot be grasped.
Men are thus compliant, as they desire in their hearts,
Those women always deceive men.
Like a snake covered by flowers, like fire covered by ashes and soil,
Form covers the mind in this way, and women are also like this.
Just like seeing a poisonous tree, pleasing to the eyes but not good;
Women are like poisonous flowers, the wise should abandon them.
Aspiring to see women, and enjoying the objects of the senses,
They never attain happiness, neither in this world nor the next.
If one universally enjoys indulgence, laziness, agitation, and deceit,
Approaching bad friends and greedily eating, one will not see the virtuous.
Those who are diligent, powerful, and brave, with merit and virtue, abandon women,
Respecting and believing in cause and effect, such a person will attain goodness by themselves.
The net of faults of women, wandering in the world,
If one can abandon women, one will be reborn in the Heaven of the YÄma gods.

In this way, the gods hear the sounds of those birds, as if hearing in a dream, with immeasurable various supreme and wonderful qualities all complete. They sing such verses, able to create beneficial good deeds for both sides.
The newly born god hears such sounds, and having heard such, he gives rise to wisdom through conditions.
That wisdom can recall where he came from:
He came from well upholding the three kinds of lovely precepts.
Remembering where he came from, having remembered, he speaks in verse, saying:
Coming here by upholding precepts, women cannot be abandoned.
The brave one, leaving women, then reaches the city of nirvana.
Not fire, nor a knife, not fire, knife, nor saw,
Can cut the bonds of women, there is no other method.
I have long abandoned, diligently hating and despising, coming here,
Abandoning thus, I attain this bliss, the supreme place of the Heaven of YÄma.
Apart from this pleasure, there is even greater bliss,
One will attain the stage of non-retrogression and will surely reach nirvana.'
At that time, the newly born celestial being, having heard the words of the birds and seen their colors, gave rise to joy in his heart and observed that celestial realm.

He saw Mount Meru, which is immeasurable in size, with countless hundreds of thousands of trees surrounded by light, and also saw flowing waters adorned with hundreds of thousands of things. He heard the various sounds of celestial birds.
Those birds had various jewel-like wings.
There were many wonderful ponds adorned with various lotus flowers, and swarms of bees emerged like smoke, adorning them with upright beauty.
Such things had never been seen before, with nothing similar to them.
Having observed the realm of the Heaven of YÄma in this way, as he had seen and heard, he was filled with joy in this way.
Having been filled with joy, he rose from under the tree. Having risen in this way, he observed his own body.
Having observed one's own body, one's own majestic virtue and radiance are of various kinds and immeasurable.
Having seen the majestic virtue and radiance of one's body, one then gives rise to the second arrogant thought, thinking:
'I am incomparable. Whatever I think of, I can attain.'
This is the second arrogance.
Next, one further gives rise to the other five arrogant thoughts, namely, the five sense faculties attached to the five sense objects.
Because of giving rise to these seven kinds of arrogance, one's mind is destroyed, and the originally practiced Dharma cannot continue, and one does not think of anything.
Because the mind is agitated and one is very negligent.

That mind is negligent and indulges in negligence. Bound by the five sense objects around one's neck, one then ascends to the top of the mountain of accumulated burdens in order to experience pleasure.
That mountain has three levels, namely, the lower level, the middle level, and the upper level.
On the lower level, there are five gardens and forests:
The first is called Fragrant Drifting;
The second is called Flame Victory;
The third is called Light;
The fourth is called Constant Joy;
The fifth is called High Accumulation.
If anything grows in that Fragrant Drifting Forest, all the fragrances are supreme, and their fragrance pervades five thousand yojanas.
In that Flame Victory Forest, the flames of immeasurable kinds, the colors and lights, all surpass the light of a hundred thousand suns.
In that Light Forest, the heavenly bodies' lights, while traveling there, the five desires and merits are all complete.
In that Constant Joy Forest, the flowing streams, rivers, and ponds, with immeasurable hundreds of thousands of heavenly fragrances, flavors, and colors, are all complete.
In that High Accumulation Forest, the highest peak has the light of the seven treasures.
Thus far, the gardens and forests of the lower grounds have been explained.
The second middle ground:

There are hundreds of thousands of vast wildernesses, countless hundreds of thousands of precious lotus ponds, and countless hundreds of thousands of delightful birds with various sounds, delightful textures, tastes, forms, and fragrances. The ground is filled with purity and clarity.
The third upper level:
At the peak of the mountaintop, there is a city one hundred yojanas in size, filled with gods.

The city is called Jewel Forest, with various rivers, the flowing waters of which are filled with food and drink. There are many heavenly trees, wonderful lotus ponds, and trees with flowers and fruits, all adorned with hundreds of thousands of things.
There are many joyful heavenly maidens, and hundreds of thousands of them fill the city.

The gods of SuyÄma Heaven and those of Tuá¹£ita Heaven go to that city, where they experience the heavenly pleasures of the five desires in the city, with delightful sounds, tastes, forms, fragrances, and so forth, causing the fire of desire to grow.
In this way, the gods on that mountain of accumulated debts experience various pleasures, roaming and playing, with various objects and various pleasures, the differences in cause and effect.
At that time, the newly born god, because his mind yearns for the pleasures of objects, goes to that mountain alone, without a companion.
An old god sees the newly born god like this, gives rise to joy in his heart, and approaches him. He says to the other old gods:
'This god is a newly born god.'
The other old gods say:
'How do you know he is newly born?'
The great god replies to the other gods:
'There are five characteristics of a newly born god, namely: First, his light covers his body, and he has no clothes. He thinks like this:
'Don't let the other gods see me naked.'
As soon as he thinks this, others see him as clothed, but in reality he is not clothed. This is the first characteristic.
There is another second characteristic of a newly born celestial being, namely, seeing things with a mind of wonder.
Having never seen them before in the gardens and forests, seeing them one looks all around. This is the second characteristic.

There is another third characteristic of a newly born celestial being, namely, seeing celestial maidens with bashful faces, giving rise to doubts in the mind, not daring to look directly. This is the third characteristic.

There is another fourth characteristic of a newly born celestial being, namely, if seeing other celestial beings, though approaching them, giving rise to doubts in the mind, the will is unsettled. This is the fourth characteristic.

There is another fifth characteristic of a newly born celestial being, namely, wanting to ascend into the sky, giving rise to fear in the mind, if flying, not going high, calmly and not quickly, going not far, playing near the ground, either beside the city walls or relying on the city. This is the fifth characteristic.
The newly born god possesses these characteristics. Let us go together to the newly born god.'
At that time, the assembly of gods surrounded the great god and all went to the newly born god. Having arrived, they said:
'Great sage, you should know!
We gods saw that you were newly born and came together.
Because of good karma, you well cultivated the precepts, without violation, without holes, without gaps, free from defilement, pure, and you attained rebirth here.'
Having spoken thus, for the newly born god they spoke thus. For the sake of indulgence, they then ascended the mountain and flew away through the sky.
In the sky, with various sounds of music, the mind gives rise to joy, and they mutually experience pleasure.
At that time, the newly born god, having seen thus, then gave rise to thought:
'I now alone walk and go up to Mount Sumbha.

Having thought this, he immediately walked into the mountain and saw a great assembly of celestial maidens, their bodies adorned with countless garments, singing with countless kinds of pleasant sounds.
Those celestial maidens saw the newly born god and each became joyful, competing to run towards the newly born god.
Having seen his eyes, they gave rise to a rare mind and observed him, and further gave rise to this thought:
'I should make offerings to him and be his wife.'
They further approached him, because they had never seen him before and were seeing him for the first time, they gave rise to a rare mind and said to the god:
'I now enjoy seeing the god, I have come for the god.
God, now, because of your own karmic fruits, you should enjoy pleasures with me.
In the gardens and forests there are various forests, and in the various forests there are various mountains, high peaks and valleys.'

There are also various heavenly realms adorned with the seven treasures, surrounded by light, with flowers and fruits of various trees filling the mountains, and everywhere there are pavilions with branches of trees.
In those pavilions there are many kinds of singing and music, and the color of the ground is like molten gold. In such a wonderful place one experiences pleasure.
There are also other places with flowing streams, rivers, and various lotus flowers adorning the area.
Moreover, in the sky there are hundreds of thousands of pavilions, adorned in various ways, most delightful.
I and the celestial sons experience various pleasures in such places.'
At that time, the newly born celestial son, by the power of his past good karma, said to the celestial maiden, 'I will now experience pleasure with you like this.
This heavenly realm, all its desires and pleasures, cannot be satiated.'
At that time, the celestial maidens together went to another forest called the Mixed Palace Forest.
In the forest, various pleasant sounds are heard, and hearing those pleasant sounds, the mind becomes joyful. The good karma is accomplished, and the results of happiness are experienced.
The forest is endowed with wonderful forms and objects, and is extremely delightful.

In this way, there are countless delightful flavors, various excellent flavors, countless delightful fragrances, and countless delightful tactile sensations - the ground is soft, so there are these tactile sensations.
The heavenly garments are not made of thread, and their touch is soft and smooth.
In this way, all of them are extremely delightful.
There are various birds with wonderful sounds, various singing sounds that are extremely delightful, and countless kinds of sounds. One experiences the pleasures of these five sense objects.
Together with the heavenly maidens, who are adorned in various beautiful ways, one experiences countless kinds of pleasures.
At that time, the forest was endowed with such merits, and countless heavenly beings and heavenly maidens filled the forest.
When the gods see this, they give rise to a first-rate sense of wonder.
Having seen the various things, they go everywhere, and in those various gardens and forests, the places where the ground is adorned with lapis lazuli and blue gems,

there are also green grounds where birds walk. The birds have various seven-jeweled colors mixed in their bodies. Those birds play and enjoy themselves with each other, making the sound of the bharata, together with those female birds on the green grounds.

Having seen this, they also see various birds in the water, with many mandarin ducks, geese, and ducks, having various different colors mixed in their adornments. Those birds all have the foremost sounds.

Having seen this, they also see the gods together with the goddesses in the gardens and forests. In those garden trees and forests, there are flowers for the six seasons, born together at one time. Those trees each compete in producing the most excellent flowers.
The light of those trees either gathers or emits, like the opening and closing of eyes. The celestial sons and celestial maidens see this and rejoice.
They also see other places, with green forests and various mixed colors. Seeing this, their minds move, and because their minds move, there are various desires and pleasures.

Looking up into the sky, they see countless hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens filling the sky, adorned with the finest garments, filling the sky in various ways, like various colors on a wall, or various different views of dancing, singing, laughing, and playing on silk or cotton cloth.
Having seen this, the minds of those gods turn and move, with various distinctions.

Having seen this in the sky, they then turn their faces and immediately see lotus ponds and forests, with various lotus flowers filling those ponds, with various shapes and various wonderful colors, such as blue, yellow, and red, and various birds in those ponds.
The gods, having observed this, give rise to a joyful mind.

At that time, the entire assembly of gods sees everywhere, with no empty space, filling the entire sky, with no place that is not filled with birds and gods, also pervading the water and the sky, with no empty space even as small as a dust mote.
Having seen this through the power of cultivating good karma in the past, they speak a verse, saying:
This great ocean of seeing cannot be satisfied,
The tongue's love of flavors is also like this, with no time of satisfaction;
The nose's greed for smelling fragrances is like seeing, unable to be filled,
The body's attachment to good touch is also the same, not knowing satisfaction;
The ear's greed for wonderful sounds is also never knowing satisfaction,
The mind's thoughts of various dharmas are all unfulfillable.
Moving within the six sense objects, leaving the light of satisfaction,
Always wandering in the state of thirst, the desire realm has countless kinds.
The gods who do not know contentment are like fire receiving fuel;
If one does not know contentment, one's own body has no place to abide.
Thus, the six fires of evil arise, blown by the wind of thoughts;
This always burns the world, but the foolish never realize it.
This ground of heedlessness is not the Dharma path of practice;
Heedlessness now destroys me and enters the realm of receiving pleasure.

' In this way, the gods recollect their past good karma. Recollecting karma, they finish speaking the verses. As it is their nature, they again become attached to the objects. There are many beloved sounds, touches, tastes, smells, and forms, with countless various qualities and characteristics, increasing moment by moment.
Having increased, they roam around with the heavenly maidens in various places, with the five desires and merits having countless kinds and distinctions, experiencing various pleasures.

They will again go to other gardens, forests, and valleys with the celestial maidens, where there are countless hundreds of thousands of wonderful birds singing, adorned with the seven treasures, extremely delightful.
They will go to other heavenly realms to enjoy pleasures together with the other celestial beings and celestial maidens there.
Having arrived there, they will ask each other with beautiful voices, speak like this, and play and enjoy themselves together with single-mindedness.

If there are other inferior celestial beings surrounded by ten thousand celestial maidens, always enjoying sensual pleasures without knowing contentment, and those celestial maidens always delight in playing and can also provide sensual pleasures to countless hundreds of thousands of celestial beings,
such celestial maidens love and enjoy sensual pleasures.
For what reasons are there more females than males in those heavens?
This has a reason:
In the heavenly realms, desire is the strongest, and delusion is in the middle.

If born in that heaven, when abiding in the intermediate state, they have already seen the heavenly maidens there in full.ğŸ”½Having seen them, the desire in their minds increases, they become attached to those heavenly maidens, and immediately turn their minds to take on the body of a heavenly maiden.
Because those in the intermediate state long for pleasure, by taking it with their minds, they immediately take on the body of a heavenly maiden.
For this reason, among the gods, there are more heavenly maidens and fewer male gods.

Thus, there are gods with ten thousand heavenly maidens, and other gods with twenty thousand heavenly maidens, and other gods with thirty thousand heavenly maidens, and other gods with forty thousand heavenly maidens, and other gods with fifty thousand heavenly maidens, and other gods with sixty thousand heavenly maidens, and in this way, up to gods with a hundred thousand, a million heavenly maidens, or there may be stronger gods with heavenly maidens in varying numbers.
The way the gods on that ground engage in sexual activity is no different from humans.
The four heavenly kings have desires like those of men and women, but they do not have impure discharges.
The thirty-three celestials, when engaging in desire, embrace each other but their organs do not touch.
The yÄma celestials, when engaging in desire, accomplish it through laughter.
The tuá¹£ita celestials accomplish desire through gazing at each other.
The nirmÄá¹‡arati celestials accomplish desire through speech, hearing sounds, and smelling fragrances.
Those who are far apart, if they smell their fragrances or hear their voices, their desires are completely fulfilled.
The paranirmitavaÅ›avartin celestials are no different from the nirmÄá¹‡arati celestials in this one respect.
If one celestial son is loved and greatly respected by all the celestial maidens, he will not become tired or sick, and will be free from flesh, bones, worms, sweat, and so forth.
Among the gods, there is a superior power that combines and interacts. At all times, that power is always indestructible, and its power and radiance are all complete.
For this reason, only one god is together with many goddesses, with countless hundreds of thousands of extreme mutual affection, always engaging in sexual activity.

The mind of that god does not guard a single woman, but all minds delight in seeing all women, acting as one wishes. All goddesses are also like this, first lustful, mutually experiencing pleasure without obstruction, experiencing pleasure as one's mind recollects.
Moreover, that god together with that goddess, as one wishes, has countless kinds and countless distinctions.
Like the gods, similar to one's own karma.

In the place of the piled-up earth, for a long time, with countless kinds of five desires and merits, playing and experiencing pleasure, with many heavenly beings and many heavenly maidens, proceeding in sequence.
They will then arrive at another forest called Adorned Wind Forest, where they will roam and play in order to experience pleasure.
They will see other gods whose past karma is exhausted, and among the celestial maidens, their time has come and they are about to fall.
For those gods about to fall, signs will appear, like having an illness.
The signs are as follows:
If those gods approach a lotus pond, the flowers will not open, this is the first sign.
Moreover, for those gods about to fall, the second sign is that if they approach a forest tree or a lotus pond, the bees will leave the forest and lotus flowers, this is the second sign.

Furthermore, for those gods about to fall, the third sign is that when those gods are playing with the celestial maidens, if they hear their singing, they will become disgusted, this is the third sign.
Moreover, for those gods about to fall, the fourth sign is that if they approach a forest tree, all the flowers on that tree will wither, this is the fourth sign.
Furthermore, the fifth sign of the celestial beings' retrogression is that when they wish to play in the palaces, they are unable to walk in the sky. This is the fifth sign.

These five are the signs of the celestial beings of YÄma's desire for retrogression, just as when the celestial beings of the Heaven of the Thirty-three are about to retrogress, they are attached by flies and other insects, and sweat appears, indicating it.
The signs of the celestial beings of the Heaven of the Thirty-three about to retrogress are like this.
Because the celestial beings of YÄma's good karma is exhausted, these signs appear, indicating their retrogression.
There are twelve great signs of death, and one sees these signs of impending death in sequence.

When the celestial beings are about to retrogress, the signs of death appear. Namely, when the celestial beings wish to emit light, the light does not come out but returns into their bodies, just like the setting sun.
Furthermore, the signs of retrogression appear. Namely, the celestial beings see flower garlands and fruits, but their minds are not delighted.
Furthermore, the signs of retrogression appear. Namely, the flowers worn on the heads of the celestial beings fall off.

Furthermore, the signs of regression manifest. This refers to when the gods look at their bodies in the water and see the form of a body that is not a divine body, but rather see the form of a body that will be born in some other realm - if they see a hell being, a hungry ghost, an animal, or a human form, such different visions manifest as they regress from this state and are born in the hells and other realms.

Furthermore, the signs of regression manifest. This refers to when the gods look at their bodies in the water and, having seen their bodies, become frightened, and having become frightened, their body hair stands on end.
Furthermore, the signs of regression manifest. This refers to when the gods see their own abode as ugly and not majestic.

Furthermore, the signs of regression manifest. This refers to when the gods, in whatever place they sit - whether it be a place of lapis lazuli, gold, silver, crystal, or sapphire - that place becomes unstable and shakes.
Moreover, the signs of decline manifest, namely, when those gods are blown by the wind, they shake greatly, and the touch is extremely harsh.
Moreover, the signs of decline manifest:
The touch of those gods' garments is heavy like a diamond.
Having seen this, their minds become sorrowful. When the mind is sorrowful, they have no delight in the delightful sounds, tastes, touches, forms, and smells;
Having been like this, they then approach the fire of impermanence.
Moreover, there are other different signs of decline that manifest, namely:
In various places, on walls of lapis lazuli and so forth, in mirrors, or in other places, when looking at their own body images, they do not see their heads.
Moreover, the signs of decline manifest:
Or they see their own heads on the ground. Seeing such signs, death is not far away.
Those goddesses, knowing this, become disgusted and abandon him.
That god becomes sorrowful, and thoughts of separation arise. There is such suffering.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
The suffering of birth is not even one-sixteenth of this suffering.

Again, the twelfth sign of decline is as follows: The mind of that god becomes confused and unstable, spinning like a fire wheel, not thinking of a single place, his mind extremely agitated. Due to the suffering of decline, his current life force is about to be extinguished, like the faint light of a lamp with exhausted oil.
In this way, that god knows and sees that he is about to fall and perish. The celestial maidens who always follow him see this and all abandon him.

Just as birds see a burning tree and fly away, without considering the merits it had in the past, the celestial maidens see the god about to fall and also leave in the same way. The other gods follow him.
At that time, the god sees the departure of the women in this way, and with a composed mind, he endures and speaks a verse, saying:
'All of this is due to one's own karma, thus experiencing the fruits and retributions,
When women see a god about to fall, they abandon him from afar and do not approach.
Because his own karma is exhausted, he is separated from immeasurable bliss.
When the celestial maidens see a falling god, they go to other gods.
This bliss is impermanent and definite, and the nature of the mind is also like this.
Women's desires are evil, and friends are untrustworthy and evil.
These four kinds of great suffering always oppress at all times.
Therefore, one should abandon them as one would abandon poison and fire.
Because of karma, one obtains bliss; because of karma, one obtains suffering.
Because of karma, one is destroyed; because of karma, one sees like this.
Thus, the gods have great bliss and enjoy the five merits,
But later, when their meritorious karma is exhausted, the falling gods are not free.
Thus, it is said that birth and death are all the illusions of karma.
The one who shows the path to liberation is the true Buddha.
If there is agitation in the mind, then one does not see the faults,
That fool is bound by them, therefore one should stay away from women.
The sun is not the cause of darkness, nor does fire become cold,
Women have no loving mind, and little love does not last.
Like the earth remains still, like the wind moves and does not stay,
The nature of women is without kindness, therefore there are such faults.
Even if a man serves women for a long time,
Seeing decline, he abandons them from afar, like a bird leaving a dried-up pond.
The one who goes high does not fall, stones and such cannot fly,
Mountains cannot walk, women have no good friends.
Always able to create obstacles, destroying the name of Dharma and meaning,
Not beneficial, storing up, giving rise to all faults.
Diamond can be made soft, the sun can also be separated from heat,
Women do not abandon deception, this is the nature of their inherent dharma.
Not by various kinds of affectionate speech, not by offerings or gifts,
Can one attract women, their minds are like fire, hard to approach.
When one obtains pleasure, they accompany it, when one obtains suffering, they abandon it.
They do not remember countless favors, but hold a single offense in their minds.
In gardens, forests, and mountains, they achieve countless pleasures,
But once they obtain decline and distress, women dislike and abandon them.
' The gods, having seen the heavenly maidens thus abandon their bodies, immediately contemplate that all worldly dharmas are like this, and have already spoken this verse.
The minds of women are firm. When the original gods are about to die, they immediately leave and rely on other gods.
Just as in winter, when the lotus flowers wither, the bees see them and immediately abandon them, going elsewhere.

At that time, the celestial maiden who had fallen from the heavens due to the exhaustion of her desires went to other heavens, and again enjoyed the five kinds of music, singing and dancing, and various pleasures, in the gardens, forests, lotus ponds, and the various bird sounds of the wish-fulfilling trees, adorned with hundreds of thousands of things, forgetting the celestial beings who had previously always enjoyed pleasures with her, and enjoyed various pleasures with other celestial beings.

In a short while, she forgot as if a hundred thousand lifetimes had passed. Seeing the previous celestial beings fall, in a single thought she forgot their merits. Women are like this, abandoning kindness and not remembering it.
The nature of women is to have no attachments. They only love because of things. If there is something needed, then they approach men.
But their own nature is not ultimate in any situation. Past, future, and present are all unable to know their nature.
Because the mind moves, like a whirling fire wheel, like a gandharva city and mirages, it cannot be grasped.
The nature of women is also like this, and cannot be grasped.
In this way, the celestial beings who are about to fall away abandon their current state and go to other heavens.
The celestial beings who are about to fall away, due to the influence of their past karma, will again speak a verse, saying:
If the mind of the celestial beings is shaken, and they indulge in desires like this,
They will not be afraid of falling away, and will definitely fall from the celestial realm.
If celestial beings are born in the celestial realm, they will definitely fall away later;
Just as when the day is over, night will definitely come.
The day is like one's life, and the night is like falling away;
Knowing these two, one should contemplate not being born and dying.

The celestial beings, in this way, contemplate their past lives. Having contemplated, they take the time in the human realm as a metaphor, and do not take the time in the celestial realm as a comparison.
Why is this?
Celestial beings have no day or night, because they always have their own light, so it is always daytime for them.
At that time, the god, having observed the god who was about to fall like this for a long time, returned to the heavenly way and definitely enjoyed the fruits of good karma.
Moreover, the god-son played and enjoyed himself in the garden and forest, with the sounds of the five kinds of music, in the streams and valleys, among the lotus groves, or on the mountain peaks.
In such places, together with the heavenly maidens and other gods, he experienced various kinds of happiness.
Relying on his original good karma, he experienced the fruits of happiness, until his created good karma was exhausted. When the good karma was exhausted, he fell from that heavenly realm.
Having fallen from the heavens, he came and went as he had come and gone, falling into the hells, hungry ghosts, or animals.
